title: Built Through Reps
subtitle: Chapter 2 Subtitle
description: Mastery doesn't happen in a moment — it's forged through consistent, intentional repetition. This chapter examines how showing up, rep after rep, creates strength and strategy alike. Featuring parallels between building great software and building great squats, it's a case for doing the work — especially when it's boring.

links.name: No Filter: The Inside Story of Instagram by Sarah Frier
links.summary: A detailed, behind-the-scenes look at Instagram's transformation from Burbn to a cultural phenomenon.

links.name: Basecamp's Shape Up Method – Signal v. Noise
links.summary: An approach to product work that values thoughtful iteration, foundational improvements, and meaningful user feedback.

links.name: Talking to Humans — Giff Constable
links.summary: A practical guide to validating ideas and rediscovering motivation by speaking directly with the users you aim to serve.

links.name: Angela Duckworth – Grit: The Power of Passion and Perseverance
links.summary: Explores why sustained effort matters more than intensity, and how consistency builds excellence.

links.name: Darren Hardy – The Compound Effect
links.summary: Details how small actions done consistently lead to exponential outcomes — a key insight for boring but high-leverage work.

links.name: Martin Fowler – Is High Quality Software Worth the Cost?
links.summary: Argues that invisible work like refactoring and testing leads to faster long-term delivery — a strong product parallel to back-off sets and mobility work.
